eecs2030.lab1

Class HounsfieldWindow

  • java.lang.Object
    • eecs2030.lab1.HounsfieldWindow

  • public class HounsfieldWindow
extends Object
    A class that represents a windowed view of Hounsfield units. A Hounsfield window is defined by two values: (1) the window level, and (2) the window width. The window level is the Hounsfield unit value that the window is centered on. The window width is the range of Hounsfield unit values that the window is focused on.

    A window has a lower and upper bound. The lower bound is defined as the window level minus half the window width:

    lo = level - (width / 2)

    The upper bound is defined as the window level plus half the window width:

    hi = level + (width / 2)

    Hounsfield units are mapped by the window to a real number in the range of 0 to 1. A Hounsfield unit with a value less than lo is mapped to the value 0. A Hounsfield unit with a value greater than hi is mapped to the value 1. A Hounsfield unit with a value v between lo and hi is mapped to the value:

    (v - lo) / width
